content: be working into the single crochets that joined the two squares chain 10 skip 2 stitches single_crochet x23 chain 5 skip 2 stiches treble_crochet place a stitch marker into the top of the treble_crochet to help keep track of the start of the next round 24 ch10 spaces figure 16 the first ch10 space made by skipping 2 stitches note make sure that when you get to the 4th side you only work into one of the squares figure 17 18 ch10 spaces around 3 sides left all 24 ch10 spaces center and not stitching the pouch closed right 2-10 chain 10 single_crochet into ch10 space x23 chain 5 treble_crochet into treble_crochet of last round 24 ch10 space figure 18 using a stitch marker to keep track of working direction and starting point copyright © 2025 by megyn burnett all rights artificial intelligence or algorithmic intelligence ai technologies is expressly prohibited 15 you can choose to make the mesh all one color or you can change colors like i did for this tutorial the process is the same as changing the color from the pouch to the mesh figure 19 a closer look at the twist method for changing colors 11 chain 6 single_crochet into ch10 space x24 slip_stitch to beginning 12 chain 1 6 single_crochet into ch6 space single_crochet x24 slip_stitch to beginning figure 14 the mesh bag up to round 11 i changed colors at row 6 figure 21 the round of single_crochet around the top of the bag i chose to do mine in the same color i used for the first five row of mesh copyright © 2025 by megyn burnett all rights reserved this pattern is for personal use only this pattern or parts of it may not be reproduced distributed or resold translated published altered shared or posted on the internet or offline you can sell items made from this pattern provided they are handmade by yourself and you give credit to the designer without limiting the author s exclusive rights any use of this pattern to train generative artificial intelligence or algorithmic intelligence ai technologies is expressly prohibited 16 making the handles 13 chain 50 skip 34 stitches 5 ch6 spaces single_crochet slip_stitch into the next st chain 1 turn the project to crochet into the ch50 space half_double_crochet into the next st 50 half_double_crochet into the ch50 space half_double_crochet into the same st that the chain is attached to slip_stitch into next st fasten_off note it may be helpful to use a stitch marker to help keep count here i put 1 marker every
